diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+#pragma once
+
+#include <ATen/core/SmallVector.h>
+#include <stdint.h>
+
+namespace at {
+
+/// A container for sizes or strides
+using DimVector = SmallVector<int64_t, 5>;
body:
Yeah c2 is probably using 4 more often.
this is defined earlier, I'm going to change it to DimVector in aten which is 5 elements.
Should we change or use the one in aten to be consistent(or change at::DimVector to be 4 elements)?
